ygData.subject: NEAT4J - ClassCastException in NEATSpecieManager
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I m working with neat4j but I need to make it stoppable in order to resume an evolution later. I did it saving the serialization of the population object.

Hi, I'm working with neat4j but I need to make it stoppable in order to res=
ume an evolution later. I did it saving the serialization of the population=
 object. The evolution starts and moves through epochs. Unfortunately I'm e=
xperiencing a problem in the NEATSpecieManager class. From line 49:

if (ap=
plicantGenes[applicantIdx] instanceof NEATLinkGene) {
	weightDiffTotal +=3D=
 (((NEATLinkGene)applicantGenes[applicantIdx]).getWeight() - ((NEATLinkGene=
)repGenes[repIdx]).getWeight());
}

The sum of weightDiffTotal at line 50 l=
ooks at the weight property of NEATLinkGene or NEATNodeGene, because Genes =
can be both Links and Nodes. 
Unfortunately, for some reason, sometimes, I =
get a ClassCastException because it casts the object to a Link even if it's=
 a Node.
The applicantIdx as a certain value... let's say, 80, while repIdx=
 is 1.
To solve this I simply catch the exception and skip the instruction.=
.. and I know that this is bad! That's why I'm here.
Should i change the ca=
st and comprare Links with Nodes? To be honest... i'm not really sure of wh=
at's going on here.

I hope you can help me. Thanks!
